Template.title: Problem Concern Act (Condition)
Template.Notes:
This is an act in CDA, I made it a list because it "enumerates a collection of resources that are in some list, and provides features for managing the list. The list resource references other resources"
And the Problem concern act is an "Observations of problems or other clinical statements captured at a point in time are wrapped in a ""Concern"" act"
Let me know if you think that this is an improper mapping.

Constraint.NarrativeText: SHALL contain at least one [1..*] identifier="#AUTO_GENERATE:HIDE#" (CONF:1150-250).
SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] code="CONC" Concern (CodeSystem: HL7ActClass urn:oid:2.16.840.1.113883.5.6) (CONF:1150-70).
SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] date (CONF:1150-71).
Constraint.Label: Date

Constraint.Label: Entries

SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] text (CONF:1150-151).
Constraint.Label: Narrative

Template.title: History of Present Illness section
Template.Description: The History of Present Illness section describes the history related to the reason for the encounter. It contains the historical details leading up to and pertaining to the patients current complaint or reason for seeking medical care.

Constraint.NarrativeText: SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] text (CONF:1150-199).
SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] code="10164-2" History of present illness (CodeSystem: LOINC urn:oid:2.16.840.1.113883.6.1) (CONF:1150-200).
SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] mode="snapshot" (CONF:1150-750).

Template.title: Physical Exam section
Template.Description:
The Physical Exam section includes direct observations made by the clinician. The examination may include the use of simple instruments and may also describe simple maneuvers performed directly on the patients body. This section includes only observations made by the examining clinician using inspection, palpation, auscultation, and percussion; it does not include laboratory or imaging findings. The exam may be limited to pertinent body systems based on the patients chief complaint or it may include a comprehensive examination. The examination may be reported as a collection of random clinical statements or it may be reported categorically.
The Physical Exam section may contain multiple nested subsections: Vital Signs, General Status, and those listed in the Additional Physical Examination Subsections appendix.
